alert.note: Alert for Cass; Menard; Morgan; Sangamon (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 14 at 6:11PM CDT until May 14 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Menard County in central Illinois... Northwestern Sangamon County in central Illinois... Southeastern Cass County in west central Illinois... Northeastern Morgan County in west central Illinois... * Until 915 PM CDT. * At 611 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Springfield, Sherman, Riverton, Williamsville, Ashland, Pleasant Plains, Grandview, Spaulding, Dawson, Clear Lake, Philadelphia, Cantrall, Salisbury, Farmingdale, Capital Airport, Prentice and Sinclair. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
